(Chapter originally written by Himir, though former182 did a little editing here and there to clean it up for the re-upload)

All you can see is black, then you open your eyes and feel the hard metal floor your sitting on. Then you remember, you had passed out when some guy offered you a drink, saying it would be the best thing you ever experienced.

"Great, now where am I?" things don't look quite like they should, but you can't put your finger on why. you almost fall 100 feet when you don't notice the edge of the metal surface you are standing on. you look around and see there are dozens of identical giant metal containers in a rough square. you look down to the ground and see about five giant platforms, raised by large pillars. You look up and see the sun is in the middle of the sky. Wherever you were, it was noon.

But seeing all of this didn't quite add up. Why were you here of all places? Was this some kind of cargo facility for ships? And why did the overall layout look so familiar?

You had seen something like this place before, but where? Docks usually had cranes, and it would take a fleet of massive ships to take these containers where ever they needed to be taken. and those platforms on the ground didn't exactly look like cutting edge loading technology, they looked more like benches.

...

Benches?

Then it hit you. You knew what this place reminded you of. A locker room, like those at a swimming pool. Those platforms were benches, but too massive or tall for any normal person to sit on. and the metal containers, they were the lockers, but could easily have a hundred people stuffed inside. You look up and realize that wasn't the sun, it was a light-bulb.

No sooner had you realized this, you heard voices and laughter. Suddenly, a door you hadn't noticed before opened and dozens of very attractive young women that you recognized instantly from all the video games you played, and the mangas and anime you've read and watched; poured in, wearing only bathing suits. The sound of the metal lockers opening and banging shut was almost deafening at your scale.

The ground, or rather, the locker you were standing on, shook as someone opened it to get their clothes. You almost faint from blushing as these twenty-to-thirty giant girls undress and put their clothes on. You notice a clothes basket at the bottom of the locker next to yours, you slowly make your way over there.

'I wish I could sneak out,' you whispered to yourself as you turned around, waiting for her to change.
"Look, I'll only be gone for a few hours," she explains, "stay here until I get back and dont leave. If somebody knocks on the door, dont answer it, ok?"

"I know I know... I wouldnt wanna revealed in 'a dorm full of mages, warriors, space pirates, bounty hunters, and superheroes'."
*SLAM!* By that time, she already left! Without even saying goodbye! Sure, she'll be right back but still!
Once again, you were alone... all alone in a big scary place where someone like you does not belong. You tried to keep calm about this whole situation. After all, at least you werent small anymore! Yet, while dont you feel much better about it?

At that moment, you could almost overhear laughter coming from behind you... a lightly high-pitched feminine laughter echoing from afar. It felt like it was laughing at YOU. But there's no one else in the room, is there?

You looked in the mirror and saw the reflection of the window.... You could see someone standing on the roof of a building. A white-haired figure in a black dress wearing a white mask. Although it was far away, you see glowing yellow eyes not covered by that mask staring toward your direction!

Does it see you?!

You quickly turned around and looked out the window.... but by then, it was gone! No masked figure up on the roof.
"W...weird," you said to yourself. Could someone really be watching you?
"It's gotta be just my imagination," you shook your head as you closed the curtains. Yet... you still had a very bad feeling about it. But what could it be?

For some reason, youre starting to wish you did take 'The Bad-Apple Philosophy-666'!
122211221211221122.title: Two can keep a secret...

choices: Samus takes you somewhere.
you start to shrink!
1222112212112211221.content:
(Chapter originally written by Himir)

with nothing better to do, you put on the clothes Marino had procured for you. since she was considerabley thinner than you, her loose fit clothes were almost snug on you, but it wasn't uncomfortable.

You stood there and took your first good look at Marino's room. She had several chests with objects you assumed once belonged to someone else, and a rack of various twin knives, many of which you recognized from the Command Mission game. You took a gander inside her closet to see a rack of her clothes, and in a standing case you found her outfit from the game.

A knock at the door made you jump as you spun into the closet and carefully closed it. It had slants so you could look out. A familiar voice followed the knocking.

"Marino, are you in there?" you recognize Samus' voice from last night. the knob shook but it was locked. You give a small sigh of relief, but the click of a tumbler came to your attention in the reletive silence. You look up and watch as Samus steps in cautiously. she was wearing the blue two-piece suit from some of the game endings with high enough completion rate.

"Good, I'll take a quick look around the room to see if her 'collection' has grown. The other's might not care about her proffesion, but I will not let a Thief live here unchecked." you watched as Samus opened and closed the chests in rapid succesion, as though she had memorized the contents of each one before. She hesitated once or twice, but only enough that you could notice. "Nothing of note, but I'll need to compare those doll clothes to others on the market." You knew she was talking about your original outfit.

"Just the closet is left." you want to say 'Shit!' but you squeeze behind the standing case as best you can, before the closet door opens. You don't dare try and peek around the corner, Samus was all business, with super-human abilities due to her transfused Chozo blood and training, you'd be better off not raising the ire of a feared and respected Bounty Hunter.

You stood there for at least a minute without so much as blinking or breathing before you heard Samus say "Nothing here, she's getting better." you see her shadow disappear from against the light from outside, and give a small sigh of relief.

You're spun around so suddenly it hurt when you stopped, and you felt yourself hit a wall with your chest. your arms hurt badly, most likely because Samus was holding both of your wrists between your shoulder blades with one hand. You cry in pain a couple times, having never stretched that way and you could feel your back cramping.

"Who are you? What do you want?" Samus demanded. All that came out when you tried to respond were yelps of pain. Samus eased her grip then spun you once more and threw you on to the ground. You feel her boot place it self between your shoulders as she kneeled on you.

"Again, Who are you?" through small gasps, you give your name. "What are you doing in here, and answer truthfully, the only reason you're not through that window is because I'm in a good mood."

"I'm-I'm a friend of Marino's." you answer to a level of honesty, "She...She snuck me into her room." also true, but not totally accurate.

"Why were you hiding?"

"She told me to stay in her room and not to answer her door, but when you tried to come in, I hid." Not completely the truth as you were already hiding when she broke in.

You felt her get off of you, "Sit up." you respectfully oblige. "back against the shelf." she tells you, refering to the cabinet behind you.

Samus crouches infront of you and examines you carefully. You eye her physique while trying to avoid her gaze. You couldn't tell if she noticed or not since she didn't say anything. "Why are you wearing Marino's clothes?" just her icy gaze nearly winds you. She was someone you didn't want to bullshit.

"Long story, but I can't wear my old clothes anymore, so Marino lent me some of hers before she left just now to her athletics class." You might have been able to convince Marino with your on-the-spot stories, but you weren't about to try and make a bold-faced lie to someone like Samus Aran.

"So you're saying that thief has learned of a way to get PEOPLE past an infallible system developed by the greatest technological, if not immature, genius? I'll have to present this to the others, she can't defend herself this time, and you are coming with me." Oh boy...what had you gotten yourself, and Marino into now? Samus dragged you to your feet and you notice that she is quite tall, almost a head taller than yourself.

She holds you by both arms as she takes you towards the door.
1222112212112211221.title: Under new supervision

choices: Samus loses you among the clutter.
Samus finds you.
12221122121122112212.content:
(Chapter originally written by Himir)

Your being lead to Marino's door when a familiar sensation overcomes you. Without your hands, you use your shoulder to scratch your face, but it's not just your face, your whole body feels like thousads of insects are crawling all over you, tickling and itching your every nerve. You fidget trying to get the itch but nothing works, and it only makes Samus crack down on your more.

"Stop fidgeting or I will drag you out if I have to" she said grabbing you by one of your wrists.

"I'm sorry, but I just can't get this itch." you say as you use your free hand to scratch your other shoulder and your knees to scratch one another. All in all it makes Samus back up, looking at you weird.

You get up against the wall, trying to find a way to make it stop but it persists relentlessly. While you were next to a standing shelf you held on to it to keep your balance, you feel you arm stretching, not away from it, more like it was getting higher. And you stopped suddenly, ignoring the sensation. A thousand thoughts go through your head, but the thought that Samus was still here rang through.

You look up, eyes wide at Samus to see if she had realized what was happening to you. She obviously has, but when you look up she assumes a defensive stance, not letting you out of her sight. Just based on your glance you were already almost half your height. You glance to your side and see that the corner of the room was cluttered with odds and ends, probabley the only place you'd be able to escape Samus.

You make a dive for the pile of random stuff knocking over a chest that was almost as big as you and scattering its contents all over you. Fortunately, none of it was heavy or sharp.
12221122121122112212.title: you start to shrink!

choices: Give yourself up
Keep running.
122211221211221122121.content:
(Chapter originally written by Aerodeth)

It wasnt a very good hiding spot even for someone your size, but something told you it was all about to change! You figured it was gonna be inevitable... you just hope it'll kick in quickly before Samus breaks you in half for resisting arrest!

Speaking of which, she was very observant to where you tried to dash off to. Not that she'd have to be. Your hiding spot was a little obvious!
"Tsk!" you heard her tsk followed by her footsteps coming closer and closer to your direction, "It looks like that thief is terrible at choosing her accomplices. Come on out, [Alex] if that is your real name. Marino's not gonna save you. She's abandoned you. You owe her no loyalty."

You dont need her. All you need is just a little more time. You never thought you'd actually be GLAD that youre shrinking!

"Alright. Suit yourself. HYA!!" She knocked that pile flying all across the room with a single kick! That coulda hurt you pretty bad... BUT...
"What the?!" Samus's calm and collective expression on her face quickly changed to absolute shock at the fact that the man hiding under the pile wasnt there! Nothing left but that one set of clothes you borrowed from Marino...

"H... how did he do that?" she leaned down toward those clothes with a hand to her chin. Unnoticed by her was that tiny little man running past her toward the door she picked open! That was a close one. You may have been reduced to Marino's puny little pet size, but at least you might have a better chance at fleeing this damn dorm and never looking back! The question as to whether or not you'll get your normal size back doesnt break through your already-determined mind!
By the time Samus finally realized something was off, you had already fled down the hall running as fast as your legs could take you. The red-velvet carpetfilled hallway seemed pretty empty. You didnt pass a single gigantic girl in sight! Not that it was a bad thing...

...Spoke too soon! You stopped in your tracks at the sight of two big black boots in front of you, blocking your path. Being too curious for your own good, you looked up to see what giant anime/videogame girl you just bumped into now.
Working your way up, you noticed greenish colored pantyhose over the legs, a big black and grey debonair dress with a little purple on the sides. You noticed a pretty little black lacey bonnet over her long flowing grey hair. Her face was covered under a mask, but you could make out big yellow eyes gazing down at you from behind the mask.

...wait! That girl! She's the one saw in the mirror!
"Y...y...YOU!" for some reason, her cold unsoothing presence chilled you down to your soul. You dont know why, but you had a bad feeling about her. Although you couldnt see her face, you could sense an eerie grin on it as she gazed down at you. The eyes were completely focused on you as you slowly backed away from her, watching your every move. It was almost like a hungry hawk staring down at a little mouse before tearing into it with razor-sharp talons!

Your brain was telling you, 'Run you moron!! RUN!!!!' but your feet took too long to react! When the blood finally rushed to them, you turned around and ran as possible to the other direction! No surprise, the masked girl chased after you. She was walking very slowly after you, but her boots were only inches away from you as they came down making little tremors with every step. She could step on you really easily, but every time she steps close to you, she misses you by a few inches. Is she just trying to scare you or something?!

Cuz it's working! Not only that, but youre starting to get tired! Damn it, why did you push yourself leaving Marino's room?! Better yet, why did you even leave Marino's room in the first place?! Sure Samus wasnt exactly friendly with you, but you'd be in better hands!

...Uh oh. End of the hall. Nothing but a table with a pot of dandelions in the corner. No stairs, no doors, not even a window. Youre trapped. With no other options available, you ducked behind the leg of the table and caught your breath. The eyes of the masked girl were still on you as she caught up with you. Sweat dripped off your face as she leaned down toward you. You backed against the corner of the wall, shivering from the ice cold presence of her big pale hand reaching out for you...

God only knows what she has in store for you, but you were defenseless. You closed your eyes and awaited your fate.

"WHERE ARE YOU, TRESPASSER?! I KNOW YOURE OUT HERE!" Just then, you overheard Samus's voice call out to you. And by the time you opened your eyes, the masked girl was gone! But how?! She was just a couple feet (or a couple inches) away from you a few seconds ago! Now she's gone? How does she do that?

"This is your final warning, [Alex]!" You could see Samus stepping toward your direction, looking everywhere for you, "If you dont come out and give yourself up right now, I will alert the entire dorm that we have a male who snuck in!" She pulled out some sort of walkie-talkie from her pocket. It didnt look like she was joking. But then again, Ms. Aran isnt the time joke, after all!

"I'm giving you to the count of three!" she gives you fair warning as she seems to be hanging a finger over on the buttons. "One....."

Damn. Looks like youre not gonna be sneaking out of the building anytime soon. It was bad enough a few of the girls know of your existence... a rookie ninja, a playful robot, a touchy fairy, a sharp bounty hunter, and some creepy yellow-eyed girl in a mask! Now youre risking to put the whole damn building on red-alert over you! You dont need that kind of attention. You dont want that kind of attention!

"C'mon, [Alex]! If you know what's good for you, you wont risk testing the tolerance of a few thousand woman who are highly trained in self-defense. Two...."
122211221211221122121.title: Let your terror teach it's secrets...

1222112212112211221211.content:
(Chapter originally written by Himir)

"OKAY! I GIVE UP!" you call out as loud as you possibley can, hoping the giant bounty hunter would hear you.

She obviously hears something, as she hesitates and looks around cautiously, her finger a hairsbredth from the button. To assist in her search you jump and wave your arms as you call to her, trying to make yourself as noticable as possible.

For better or worse, it worked. you saw as she locked on to something in her periphial, you. She had a surprised look as she gazed in your direction, then she approached your location frighteningly quick; you stepped backward as her sedan-sized boot landed right in front of you, and looked up to see her descending with her hand outstretched towards you. you close your eyes and clench for your immanent trip skyward.

But it never comes. You don't even feel her fingers wrap around you, so you open one eye and meet with two gorgeous blue eyes, and a stern, but beautiful face. You really didn't get a good look when you were in the room, but she had an aluring, if not intimidating face, and you sort of lost yourself for a moment in her eyes. Once you regained your composure, you realize she is examining you, and when you look behind you, and she's doing something with her hand in correlation to you, like she was measuring you or something.

"I won't harm you, but you must do as I say, and I will accomodate to carry you however you are comfortable with." Samus said, seemingly over your condition and having put together what had occured earlier.

Over all, you had only been 'carried' three different ways; in the shirt of a teenager, an android's fanny pack, and the same android's panties, so anything Samus was refering to would be new to you. "I suppose just sitting in your palm would be just fine." You weren't going to even try to take any liberties with her offer.

Her hand that was behind you cupped to allow your presence, which you feel both excited and frightened about.
1222112212112211221211.title: Give yourself up

choices: Answer the question for Navi.
Keep quiet.
12221122121122112212112.content:
(Chapter originally written by Aerodeth)

As frightened as you are of where or who she is taking you to, you are sorta kinda anxious to see who youre gonna end up meeting next. No doubt she's gonna be any less dangerous than Samus, but you might be in better hands than that... girl... damn it, who the hell was she?! She reminds you SOOOO closely of someone and you just cant put your finger on it. Maybe it's cuz of that stupid mask, but man!

Anyways, too bad you couldnt at least say goodbye to Marino or Navi, not like they'd be willing to let you go, would they?

Oh, speak-o diablo! You can make out a little extremely bright ball of blue light flying your direction! As it gets closer and closer, the light gets even brighter and brighter! To avoid being blind you closed your eyes. Yeah, you already knew what was coming and who that blue light belonged to. It looks like little Navi coming to save the day!

"OH NO YOU DONT!"

Or maybe not. It sounded like Navi wasnt fast enough to get past Ms. Aran's keen superhuman senses! By the time you opened your eyes, you saw that slightly dimmering winged blue girl caught in Samus's hand. Hopefully, she aint squeezing her as tightly as Marino was.
"H-H-HEY!" Navi screamed one of her trademark quotes yet again, "WHAT'S THE BIG ID-"

"Save it, Navi!" Samus snapped, shutting her captive up, "I already know youre in cahoots with the thief, too!"
"L-LOOK! Rouge and I were planning to return the materia we borrowed from Aeris, but-"
"I was referring to Marino!" Samus interrupted, causing the blue dimmer to change to red!

"Oh! Uh... um...I-I-I knew that, I was just kidding!" Navi stuttered before clearing her throat, "*Ahem!* Anyway, I dont know what youre talking about! I'm not with that mechanical slut!" Ouch again!
Nonetheless, Samus didnt believe her, "I had sources telling me you were talking with that thief last night. I wanna know what about!"

"Nothing!" Navi replied, "We never talked! I would never degrade myself being near some walking trash-heap of girly parts!" Yikes! And you thought she had a big mouth in the GAME! Marino's gonna murder her if she finds out what she just said! Nonetheless, the humongous blonde bounty-hunter remained unaffected by the fairies lies. Instead, she turned her head to YOU.

"Is this little bug with you?" Samus asked you. Sure enough, that didnt go unheard by Navi!
"BUG??!! WHY YOU BIG, SPANDEX-WEARING, BRA-STUFFING-" While Navi continued shouting obscurities, you thought pretty hard of your answer. Despite her big mouth, you didnt want to get Navi in trouble, too. You ESPECIALLY dont want her to get crushed into fairy-paste when she gets tossed into the same holding cell as Marino! But it's really really difficult mustering the courage to lie to the big bad bounty hunter that could easily crush both of you in her grasp.

Your only idea was to give her a slight nonspecific answer that's kinda a lie and kinda not. "Uh...um... I'm not with her."
"THERE! You heard him yourself! I never met the guy in my life! Now lemme go already! I told ya I'm innocent!"

Unfortunately, Samus kept on walking down the hallway with the both of you. "I know something's going on that neither of you are telling me. And I will find out one way or another."
"You cant prove nothing!" Navi still couldnt keep her big mouth shut, "We're innocent! Innocent, I tell you!"

"Tell it to the Head of Security!" Samus snapped at her, "I'm sure she'd love to hear the tale." Hmm..
"Tsk! You mean that Amazonian moron, Shampoo?!" Shampoo?! "Why her?! She knows about as much English as I know about Ice-Hockey! Besides, kitty'll probably swallow [Alex] before he can get a word in!"

OOPS! She just blurted out your name! 'Smooth move, genius!' you thought to yourself as you smacked your forehead. And unfortunately for little big-mouth, Samus heard ever word she said!

"How did you know his name?" Ms. Aran questioned Navi. The blue girl blushed like crazy! "Errr...umm... uh...."
"HOW DID YOU KNOW HIS NAME?" she raised her voice speaking even more lenient and more demanding than ever! As much as she deserved the spotlight on her, you still kinda felt sorry for Navi. But what are YOU gonna do about it? Answer the question for her?
Maybe you should... you dont wanna add MORE suspicion to you than there already is, do you?
12221122121122112212112.title: Some people dont know when to SHUT UP!

"Marino, I'm here to borrow your..." a woman with long, thick, brown hair and a pink dress opened the door and stepped in, looking up to see Marino hunched over her coffee table looking like a deer in the head lights.

"What are you...?" Aerith noticed something pinned to the table by Marino's breasts. Aerith took several quick steps approaching the table as Marino stood up. she knelt down and saw it was a tiny human. she shot up and looked sternly at Marino. "Did you do this?" she said pointing to you.

I found him in Yuffie's room, and i thought...I should...let you guys know," she said constantly glancing around, making it up as she went, "I remembered you said you would be stopping by to borrow something, so i held on to him so no one else would find him." she had a very unconvincing look on her face. "I thought since you and the other older girls were in charge of the dorm, you should be the first to... know?"

Aerith kept staring at her, glanced down at you, then looked back at Marino. You cautiously step into her hand, praying you're not stuffed into another small space. The woman stood up carefully and raised her hand to her shoulder, "you can hold onto my collar, or hair so you don't fall off." she says as you crouch, clutching the edge of her dress for dear life. You look back to see Marino take a deep breath wtih a relieved look on her face. Was this woman really that scary?

1252.content:
There was no mistaking that red hair, green scales, and golden eyes. It was Granberia, Swordswoman of Fire and one of the Four Heavenly Knights!

"I'm doomed!" You mutter. Granberia blinked a few times before she picked you up. Oddly, her green-scaled hand was quite soft. Once you were brought closer to her face, you feared she might eat you.

Instead, she... sniffed you a few times. Each time lasted longer and longer. After the second sniff, she closed her eyes. After the last sniff, she opened her eyes and smirked at you.

"A man... A small toy-sized man within the walls of an all girls' dorm..." Granberia quietly said. she licked the corner of her mouth before her smirk turned into an evil grin. "and a number of women here tend to be... violent with men."

The way her head bobbed a little was a sign that she was holding back a laugh.

"But I can protect you, but we need to make a deal. Just be quiet until I can get to somewhere safe for us to talk about the terms," Granberia whispered before she placed you into an empty bag. She then tightened its draw strings until the hole was barely big enough for you to put your head through. You didn't try to escape because of Granberia's words. You then were jostled for a long time until you felt the bottom of the back flattened, like it was placed on a table.

The strings were then loosened until a green-scaled hand plucked you right out of the bag and held you. Once your eyes got used to the light, you saw that you were were in...

13.content:
Somehow, you managed to reach the basket without being detected by the thirty girls. All of which were sexy and stronger than you at your normal height.

Thanks to a bra hanging out of the basket, you quickly climbed in and hid yourself in the pile of bras, panties, shirts, and bloomers. Once again, you barely managed to stop yourself from passing out from a blush.

'Musky... I must be the luckiest man ever,' you thought, trying not to think about how all these clothes covered their privates and boobs.

"I'll take this to the laundry room," Someone said as they picked up the basket. They sounded a bit scatterbrained and innocent.

"Make sure you don't use one of your weird inventions on them, Lala!" Raven of Teen Titans's voice said in an annoyed tone.

You thought with worry, 'Lala? Lala from To Love-ru? I might be in trouble!'

"I won't! I'll just drop them off and come back!" Lala said.

They carried the basket for a few minutes before pouring the basket through probably some vent. To your credit, you didn't scream as you fell to what could have been your death, had it not been for the soft clothing cushioning your fall. They probably all were enchanted or something.

After recollecting yourself, you looked over the sides and looked around.

You were in some laundry room, going by the washing machines and drying machines. The walls had several vents and dumbwaiters. There were also a few doors, some in your size. There was a few containers, holding some gear from heroines They were some magic,some tech, and some of a mix.

"Huh... I wonder if I can get help getting back to my normal size?" you muttered. as you began to tie some bras and panties together to form a ladder.

132.content:
You had no idea what kind of heroines, villainesses, or ones disguised as the other were here. Their weapons and tools could have some sort of security measures were in place.

Pity. You wanted to try out the Hookshot from the Zelda games. You did find Linkle to be kind of cute.

After you got on the ground, you headed for a door at your size. Once you passed by it, you were please to see that behind it was a fairly normal hallway. There was a map.

However, it displayed a fairly labyrinthine map. Whether it was on purpose for security reasons, because the smaller hallways were made after the building was finished, or to better accommodate small beings, you had no idea.

You sighed and began to walk, hoping you could find a friendly person before long.

As your mind wandered, you recalled the Scarlet Devil mansion, and how it could change its innards at any time, how intruders could be lost forever.

"Dang it, brain! I need you to help me!" You grumbled as you found the first crossroads. There were three paths ahead.

One to the right, which read, "Power control"

One to the left, which read, "Water control"

and a latter to above.

After a few moments, you decided to head to...

1323.content:
You walked up to the ladder and did something you knew was a bad idea.

Look up.

Going by how big you were compared to the bra and panties, you guessed you were about 3.75-inch tall. A 6 foot person was about 19 times your size. The space above you almost vanished into infinity.

You groaned, but climbed up. As you did, you noticed that lights lit up by your feet. A brief test by stretching your leg a little let you feel some softa invisible net. You said in relief, "That solves the problem of what if I let go."

Some time later, you were getting tired, but finally reached a sign.

"Ground floor"

Beside the sign was a platform that led to the ground floor. There also was a few chairs, couches, and a refrigerator. There also a couple of door that had the universal signs for men's and women's bathroom.

"Huh..." you muttered. You also saw something that gave you relief.

An elevator.

(Chapter originally written by Himir)

You slowly make your way to the edge of the locker to jump into the basket of clothes at the bottom, and desperately hope there is a lot of soft clothes in it.

As you prepare to jump, the door to the locker you are standing on is slammed shut and you lose your balance from the massive shudder. You slip from locker and time seems to slow down to you.

info.description:
The Original version of this was created by a author who went by 'Himir'. They disappeared and eventually their account vanished, along with their stories. I talked it over with Aerodeth and I decided to revive as much as I could

As for the rules, The ones that were created by Himir are in Blue. The ones in Black are created by me. If you think of something that might be a good rule, Let me know and I'll think about it. If I decide to use it, I'll let you know and let you decide what color you want it to be in.

1. no 1 line entries.
2. no vore or crush.
3. no getting fat.
4. No Permanent Death .The characters have to be revived sooner or later. Ways are : Using a continue, Using an extra Life, being brought back by a revive spell or potion, being brought back by someone who can revive people.
5. The Main character can have their height restored, but there has to be a way to shrink him again.


Points will be awards 100 per chapter, unless you ask me not to reward you.

Here's the original body of text they had for this. Kept somewhat for Nostalgic reasons.

-----
You wake up in an all girls Dorm at 4 inches tall, time to have some fun.

3,300 views! easily my most viewed interactive, but with so few additions, the contrast is a little disheartening, like people who read aren't interested enough to add their own touch. Only 1 author has been adding along side me, though I have been adding only on rare occasions, but I think the path Aerodeth and I have comeup with might help this interactives growth.

for their time and effort to adding to this story.

the story and characters are at your complete control, but just a couple of rules:

other than that, go nuts!
